result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Patrick Ledoux was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Patrick Ledoux is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph Patrick Ledoux was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>3-10g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court
St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for Boot Camp and Substance Abuse Program.
-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 and Case #14CF51.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF51.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-No Contact with Scott Opheim.
AODA and follow through with all therapy and recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

records.addlTxt:
CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Stephen J Dunlap, DF:  Joseph Patrick Ledoux appeared from jail. There is an agreement. State to amend count 1 to a class E felony; 961.41(1m)(e)2 - Posses w/intent 3 - 10g; party to a crime is also stricken. Court amends. 
Court reviews consequences of felony conviction. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. 
Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one - Possess w/intent class E felony; 961.41(1m)(e)2. Def pleads guilty.  Court uses prelim testifmony and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1. Court dismisses counts 2 and 4. Court orders a PSI - long form. Court to schedule a sentencing hearing after completion of PSI. State moves to revoke bond pending sentencing. Court revokes bail.
Filed by Atty Dunlap. Requesting JT be a Plea Hearing. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Cory Crandall, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber Hahn,  DF ATTY:  John A Kucinski,  DF:  Joseph Patrick Ledoux appeared from jail. S/T Dep Justin Johnson. Direct by ADA Amber Hahn. Cross by Atty Kucinski. Court takes judicial notice of co-def Opheim prior drug offense/history. Court does not amend bond at this time. Crt binds def over for trial. sf  Arraignment scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Scott O.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
